customConfig.name: pageMargin
customConfig.label: Page margin
customConfig.note: Use of "vmin" units are recommended; also use others.

customConfig.name: navbarHeight
customConfig.label: Navbar height
customConfig.note: Use of PX units recommended; also use others (rem, vw, %)

customConfig.name: sidebarWidth
customConfig.label: Sidebar column width
customConfig.note: This left-side columns houses the main navigation menu. Use of PX units recommended; also use others (rem, vw, %)

customConfig.name: contentWidth
customConfig.label: Main column width
customConfig.note: This central column contains the main website content, showcasing posts. Use of PX units recommended; also use others (rem, vw, %)

customConfig.name: asideWidth
customConfig.label: Aside column width
customConfig.note: This right-side column displays a Table of Contents for easy navigation. Use of PX units recommended; also use others (rem, vw, %)

customConfig.name: slackUrl
customConfig.label: Slack URL
customConfig.note: Provide the full URL (https://...) to your Slack channel

customConfig.name: githubUrl
customConfig.label: GitHub URL
customConfig.note: Provide the full URL (https://...) to your GitHub project

customConfig.name: frontPost
customConfig.label: Select a post
customConfig.note: This option allows you to display the selected post on the front page. We strongly recommended 'hide' and 'noindex' the selected post to avoid the duplicate content issue.

customConfig.name: frontGallery
customConfig.note: Enable if you want to display a post with image gallery

customConfig.name: frontLatestArticles
customConfig.label: Show the latest articles
customConfig.note: Disabling this option may cause duplicate content issues. To avoid this, please disable the 'homepage pagination indexing' in the SEO section of your site settings.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note: The Post list section offers a range of options for managing the post list displayed on the front page, tag and author pages. In this area, you can easily enable or disable elements such as category, date or other elements.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Main font settings
customConfig.note: To explore an extensive list of available fonts, along with detailed information about their typefaces, complete range of weights, and other specifications, please visit our documentation.

options.label: Select the font used for the Body
Select the font used for the Headings
Select the font used for the Body
Select the font used for the Headings

customConfig.name: minFontSize
customConfig.label: Minimum font size
customConfig.note: The font-size of the root element in REM unit

customConfig.name: maxFontSize
customConfig.label: Maximum font size
customConfig.note: The font-size of the root element in REM unit

customConfig.name: lineHeight
customConfig.label: Line height
customConfig.note: The default line-height for the entire website

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note: Note that not all fonts support the full range of weights; instead, they will typically support a standard range between 400 and 700. To see the exact range available for the selected body font, please visit our documentation.

customConfig.name: shareTwitterName
customConfig.note: Enter your X account's handle here; it will be used when the X share button is clicked on your site e.g. 'via @XHandle'. If left blank, the default username of @SiteName will be used

customConfig.name: searchFeature
customConfig.label: Search
customConfig.note: Enable / disable the search box, which is usually located next to the top menu. In order to use the search function, you also need to install the search plugin.

customConfig.name: createSearchPage
customConfig.label: Search subpage
customConfig.note: Enabling this option will create an additional search.html page which may be required by some search plugins to display the search results on a separate page.

customConfig.name: docSearchSupport
customConfig.label: DocSearch support
customConfig.note: Enabling this option adjusts the DocSearch plugin to fit the overall look and feel of your website.

customConfig.name: galleryItemGap
customConfig.label: Item spacing
customConfig.note: Use of REM units recommended but you can also use others (px, vw,)

customConfig.name: galleryLightboxStyle
customConfig.label: Lightbox style
customConfig.note: Set the lightbox slideshow style by choosing dark or light overlay

customConfig.name: galleryLightboxOpacity
customConfig.note: Adjust the lightbox overlay transparency

customConfig.name: galleryPreloader
customConfig.label: Preloader
customConfig.note: Loading indicator is displayed with 1s delay, so if the photo loads faster it will be invisible.

customConfig.name: galleryCloseOnScroll
customConfig.label: Close gallery on page scroll
customConfig.note: Option works just for devices without hardware touch support.

customConfig.name: galleryArrowKeys
customConfig.label: Keyboard navigation
customConfig.note: Keyboard left or right arrow key navigation.

customConfig.name: newsletterFormCode
customConfig.note:
Before pasting your code, learn how to make your newsletter form as functional and visually-appealing as possible. Learn more

Remember to add a "newsletter-popup__submit" class to the submit button for the proper working of the newsletter popup.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note: Display a newsletter popup when scrolling or after a delay. Both options can be enabled at once; if neither are enabled the popup will not be displayed.

customConfig.name: newsletterScrollDistance
customConfig.label: Scroll distance
customConfig.note: Displays the popup after the user has scrolled a specified amount from the top of the page - the scroll distance must be provided in pixels.

customConfig.name: newsletterTimeLength
customConfig.label: Delay start
customConfig.note: Displays a popup after the specified time has elapsed - the delay start value should be entered in milliseconds.

customConfig.name: codeMaxHeight
customConfig.label: Max. height
customConfig.note: Specify the maximum height of the <pre> tag; for full-height set to 100%

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Table of content
customConfig.note: The table of contents is generated automatically from the headers in the post content. Specify the range of headers that should be included below:

customConfig.name: pagePrefetching
customConfig.label: On / Off
customConfig.note: Speeds-up page-loads after the initial load by prefetching in-viewport links during idle time. When enabled, it will check the current browser window for any links, then, if the browser isn't doing anything and the user isn't on a slow connection, it will start pre-loading the linked URLs so that the content will be ready when the link is clicked.

options.label: Custom - create your own date format

customConfig.name: formatDateCustom
customConfig.label: Create a custom date format
customConfig.note: More details you can find here.

customConfig.name: lazyLoadEffect
customConfig.label: Lazy load effects
customConfig.note: This option works only if the 'Media lazy load' option is enabled in the Website Speed tab under Site Settings

customConfig.name: faviconUpload
customConfig.label: Upload file
customConfig.note: The ideal size of a favicon is 16x16 pixels. Save your favicon as either favicon.png or favicon.ico

authorConfig.name: displayPostList
authorConfig.label: Display post list
authorConfig.note: Disabling the post list can cause duplicate content issues. To avoid this, please disable authors pagination in the SEO section of your site settings.

tagConfig.name: displayPostList
tagConfig.label: Display post list
tagConfig.note: Disabling the post list can cause duplicate content issues. To avoid this, please disable tag pagination in the SEO section of your site settings.
